snippet: In a dozen cases since the president called for prosecution and punishment, judges and lawyers have said his words were an “unlawful command influence,” tainting trials as a result.
abstract: Pres Obama's remarks about sexual assault in military have muddied legal cases across the country, effect that he did not intend; judges and defense lawyers in at least a dozen sexual assaults cases say Obama's words as commander in chief amount to 'unlawful command influence,' tainting trials as a result.
lead_paragraph: In a dozen cases since the president called for prosecution and punishment, judges and lawyers have said his words were an “unlawful command influence,” tainting trials as a result.

headline.main: Remark by Obama Complicates Military Sexual Assault Trials

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
